text: if you can't stand the heat get into the
kitchen because this meal requires no
cooking so you can stay nice and cool
when it's hot outside and the whole meal
goes right into this beautiful sourdough
boule when you buy your bread look for
one that's fairly lightweight and
hollow-sounding when you tap it and it
should have a nice firm crust and soft
interior so first we have to have the
sandwich across the equator the long
serrated knife comes in very handy here
there it goes pop off the top okay and
then before we get building you want to
hollow out the excess bread it's a
little too much bread for this
application but the scraps are wonderful
for croutons or you could grind them up
and make bread crumbs just let them get
stale first and you'll want to leave a
border of about an inch or so around the
edges and do the same thing with the
bottom of the loaf as well
this is a press sandwich by the way
which means you can make it ahead and
it's going to be covered in weights and
it'll flatten out as it sits okay that
looks pretty good
now for our dressing for the sandwich
start with 6 tablespoons of mayo and 3
tablespoons of capers that are rinsed
and drained I like to buy salt packed I
find they have a better flavor and
texture they're better than the brined
and lemon zest and juice the zest of a
lemon first you hold your zester upside
down and zest this way you can see that
it all stays right in that chamber so
just tap that into the bowl just like
that no cleanup and then we can get
juicing 3 tablespoons you could
certainly measure but you know me I like
to use my eyeballs I think half of a
lemon is probably going to be about 3
tablespoons and a little salt and pepper
of course always
give that a good stir until it's totally
combined we have this nice bread here
it'll soak up all of that lemony caper
flavor and just eyeball half of it over
the top and bottom of the bread even if
you think you don't like capers you
don't taste them as capers they just
offer a nice salty bite and they do have
a little bit of a fruitiness mazwell and
just spread that out with your spatula
and now we're ready for the fun part
where we start to layer our other
ingredients start with some turkey
you'll need three ounces for the
sandwich half of it goes down onto the
bottom bread I also have three ounces of
provolone cheese and again as you layer
leave that border open that will just
ensure that everything stays inside of
the sandwich once it depressed and this
is hot capicola you could also use sweet
capicola or sopressata or any kind of
salami that you like but the hot
capicola is definitely my favorite and
repeat with the remaining turkey
provolone and capocollo and then for the
top half of the bread we're going to
start with a bunch of watercress I love
watercress it's peppery and offers a
nice bit of crunch as well and then one
big tomato a beefsteak or an heirloom
tomato and then that gets layered right
over the watercress and of course you'll
want to season again
salt and pepper it takes more than you
think I promise and the pepper that's
just about it folks all we have to do
now is close up your sandwich put the
bottom half on the top and then you can
turn it back over onto itself and before
pressing we have to wrap it up into a
tidy bundle so start with plastic wrap
and get it firmly over the top like that
then for one more barrier of protection
aluminum foil and again nice and tightly
wrapped around the top
I find a tray is useful I suppose you
could put it right down onto your
countertop and then a really heavy
cast-iron skillet like this and lots of
heavy can or if you have some extra
bricks laying around you could use those
put the weight of your body onto it and
give it an initial press down to get
things moving along
and it can hang out just like this on
your countertop for at least 45 minutes
or up to 12 hours if you're going to do
it well ahead just pop it into the
fridge while it's waited and let the
magic happen are you ready for the big
reveal
I'm not amazing it's past the height
that it was when we started oh yeah how
good does that look so I'm going to cut
it in half again to make it easier to
eat and to make it a meal just serve it
with some fresh fruit I love this kind
of a sandwich with FIGS and of course
you have to have a good pile of potato
chips and there you have it very little
effort no cooking and you have a
delicious satisfying meal happy eating
